Column Comment.0: LAND RIGHT SUBTYPE: This column is used to enforce the relationship betweenLAND RIGHT and its subtypes. The value must be equal to the name of one of thevalid subtypes: LAND_AGREEMENT, LAND_AGREE_PART, LAND_LEASE,LAND_GRANTED_RIGHT, LAND_UNIT, LAND_UNIT_TRACT or LAND_TITLE.
Column Comment.1: LAND RIGHT ID: Unique Identifier for the land right. A land right is the rights youhave to land, regardless of how obtained. It may be owned outright, rented, aquiredby agreement or contract.
Column Comment.2: LAND STATUS TYPE: the type of status for a land right, such as legal, financial orworking.
Column Comment.3: R LAND RIGHT STATUS: continued, held by production, termination, inactvatedsurrendered.
Column Comment.4: LAND RIGHT STATUS SEQUENCE NUMBER: A unique sequencer added to allow aland right to have the same status more than once in its life time.
Column Comment.5: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.6: EFFECTIVE DATE: the date on which this row of data first came into effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.7: EFFECTIVE TERM: The effective length of the status term
Column Comment.8: EFFECTIVE TERM ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE: The original units used,Usually in days, months or years
Column Comment.9: EXPIRY DATE: the date on which this row of data is no longer in effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.10: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.12: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.13: SECTION OF ACT: Legislated statute under which status is achieved.(Albertasection 97, BC section 74, federal unit expansion of participating area)
Column Comment.14: SECTION OF ACT DATE: Date which land right status was associated with aregulation.
Column Comment.15: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.16: UNDETERMINED TERM IND: Indicates the term is of undetermined duration. Y=undetermined term.
Column Comment.17: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.18: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.19: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.20: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.21: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.22: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.23: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
